intro: Anapausia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican anapausia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
